channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Biden reaches 'tentative' U.S. debt ceiling deal: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: According to one of the sources familiar with the negiotation, there "might be one or two small things they need to finish."

item.title: FTX 2.0 coming up, Multichain FUD and Worldcoin raises six figures: Hodler’s Digest, May 21-27
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Editorial Staff
item.description: FTX reboot is in the works, Multichain issues spark uncertainty and Sam Altman’s crypto project Worldcoin raises millions of dollars.

item.title: Why is Grand Theft Auto 6 unlikely to incorporate cryptocurrencies?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: From time to time, rumors surface that Grand Theft Auto 6 will integrate cryptocurrency, fueling expectations that the franchise may make its way to Web3.

item.title: Binance kicks off transition to new platform in Japan
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The move follows the acquisition of the regulated crypto exchange Sakura Exchange Bitcoin (SEBC) in November 2022.

item.title: Crypto Stories: Cheds recounts how he leaned on crypto during his toughest times
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Cheds shares the story of how he shifted his focus to crypto after being diagnosed with cancer.

item.title: Crypto Biz: Ledger halts recovery service, Web3 in Hong Kong, and another CEX goes down
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: This week’s Crypto Biz explores Hotbit’s closure, Hong Kong’s licensing of crypto firms, Bitstamp’s acquisition by Ripple and Ledger’s branding crisis.

item.title: How are NFTs used in fashion and wearables?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elizabeth Gail
item.description: The fashion industry is progressively employing NFTs in conjunction with virtual technology to enhance user experiences.

item.title: Stargate community proposes removal of Fantom USDC pool to mitigate risks
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: So far, a total of 1.7 million verified members of the Stargate community have voted in favor of the proposal.

item.title: Nigerian crypto company suspends withdrawals after BTC and naira compromise
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: Efforts are underway to recover compromised assets and enhance security measures as users express concerns on social media.

item.title: Bitcoin holds 200-week average as trader says ‘inflection point’ is here
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin sentiment is overly bearish, some claim, with BTC price protecting a key moving average trend line.

item.title: How to learn JavaScript using ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: Discover how to learn JavaScript effectively using ChatGPT, an AI-powered language model.

item.title: Top metaverse property investments suffer massive losses: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Popular metaverse properties, such as Otherdeeds, The Sandbox, Decentraland, Somnium and Voxels, have all depreciated in value over the past year.

item.title: Gemini, Genesis file to dismiss SEC lawsuit against Earn product
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: Gemini said the SEC’s lawsuit against its “Earn” product — which offered yields to customers against their crypto deposits — was “ill-conceived.“

item.title: MakerDAO proposal seeks to hike DAI savings rate to 3.33%
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The DAI savings rate was increased to 1% in December 2022, leading to 35 million DAI being deposited in a month, according to MakerDAO.

item.title: JPMorgan Chase enters generative AI race with IndexGPT trademark
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: JPMorgan’s ChatGPT rival, IndexGPT, will be used across various business units, including advertising, business consulting and different finance-focused software.

item.title: Crypto hater Peter Schiff to drop Bitcoin Ordinals NFT art collection
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Despite hating on crypto for years, and calling NFTs worthless and easy to replicate two years ago, Peter Schiff is set to release an NFT art collection on Bitcoin.

item.title: Cronos Labs launches second cohort of $100M Web3 accelerator
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: On May 15, the chosen projects commenced the 12-week program after being granted seed funding of $30,000.

item.title: The Sandbox CEO’s Twitter was hacked, used to promote alleged ‘airdrop’ scam
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The executive appears to have now recovered his account.

item.title: ECB sums up digital euro prototyping exercise as it nears possible pilot launch
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The European Central Bank exercise looked at a variety of use cases, most of which were quite satisfactory, as well as the use of self-custodied wallets.

item.title: Bitcoin miner Canaan’s net loss slightly improved in Q1 amid market turbulence
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Diluted net loss per American depositary share in Q1 2023 stood at $0.51, down from $0.55 in the previous quarter.

item.title: A16z releases anonymous voting system for Ethereum
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The system uses “time-lock puzzles” to encrypt the contents of votes, making them unreadable until balloting has finished.

item.title: A week filled with exploits and uncertainty for DeFi: Finance Redefined
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: DeFi saw another multimillion-dollar rug pull this past week, and the Multichain saga continues to spiral out of control.

item.title: Neuralink gets FDA approval for ‘in-human’ trials of its brain-computer interface
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: The Neuralink device is designed to be surgically implanted and, according to CEO Elon Musk, will eventually be marketed to the general public.

item.title: Why have Bitcoin and crypto lost 60% of their market cap since their all-time highs?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Cointelegraph analyst and writer Marcel Pechman explains why the cryptocurrency market has lost 60% of its market cap, with the S&P 500 only about 15% from its all-time high.

item.title: Atlanta Fed explains Web3 finance, including XRP ‘international payment medium’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The highly accessible introductory text mentions all the concepts and names a curious reader would need, along with some assessments.

item.title: Price analysis 5/26: BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, ADA, DOGE, MATIC, SOL, DOT, LTC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: The recovery in the U.S. stock market seems to have acted as a catalyst for the relief rally in Bitcoin and select altcoins.

item.title: Twitter’s $42K API access plan could harm crypto research
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: Twitter emailed researchers to let them know they’ll either have to delete their data or pay $42,000 to keep using the platform’s API.

item.title: Bitcoin nears $27K despite ‘hot’ PCE data sparking June rate hike bets
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin decides that bad news is not bad enough as upside volatility accompanies proof that U.S. inflation remains sticky.

item.title: Memecoins: From memes to multibillion-dollar pumps, scams and rug pulls
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Memecoins have come a long way from the early days of being joke cryptocurrencies.

item.title: Fortune favors the brand: Why crypto marketing fails to live up to hype
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By German Ramirez
item.description: Your brand establishes a bond. Without that bond, your customer base will simply erode more easily.
